Membership Breakfast
Monthly Event Opportunities
EVENT CALENDAR
Membership Breakfast
​Every 2nd Tuesday at 7:00 AM
Meet other Chamber members, motivated individuals, and like-minded business people at our largest networking event of the month, with over 170 people regularly in attendance. Hear "Biz Tips" from our savviest business professionals, get great information from the month's Sponsor presentation, and visit the member Tabletops.
Click to Sponsor
Net@Nite
​Every 4th Thursday at 5:30 PM
​
​
Net@Nite is our monthly evening networking event, drawing an after-work crowd for a more relaxed experience. Net@Nite is about slowing down the pace and taking the time to form more personal and trusting relationships that we need with those individuals with whom we do business.
​
Click to Sponsor
Happy Hour
​Every 1st Friday at 5:00 PM
​
For low stress networking, the Chamber holds a Members-Only Happy Hour the first Friday of each month at a member restaurant or bar. These are the perfect settings to continue building those personal relationships that lead to solid working partnerships with other Chamber members. Non-member guests are welcome only with the invitation of a Chamber member, and registration by the inviting member is required.
Lunch Mob
​Every 3rd Thursday at 11:30 AM
Sprung from a desire to support member restaurants during the covid-19 pandemic, Lunch Mob is a casual two-hour window where you can have lunch with other chamber members at a local member's food spot without the formality of strict starting/ending times. Come and go as you please so that you never have to have lunch alone!
Copyright Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce.  All Rights Reserved.
﻿
3150 SW 145 Avenue, Suite 315  |  Miramar, FL 33027
Phone: (954) 432-9808 |

About Us
About the Chamber
The Chamber is committed to providing a variety of venues to assist the business owners of our region to develop better businesses by becoming better business leaders. From its humble beginnings 50 years ago, the Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce is thriving and is committed to helping your businesses thrive too!
What is the Chamber and what does it do?
Established in 1969, the Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce is the premier business organization serving Southwest Broward County. The Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce is made up of over 850 members representing businesses of all sizes, from single-person shops to corporations with thousands of employees. We have members who have just started their business and members who have been in business for more than a century. The Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce advances its membership business agenda through advocacy, leadership and engagement.
Why would I need to join the Chamber?
Now, more than ever, building substantive relationships is crucial to sustaining and growing your business.  The Chamber provides opportunities on a daily basis for you to meet new contacts, whether it’s at a Membership Breakfast or a professional development event.
The Chamber provides its members with opportunities for growth both personally and professionally through networking, visibility and leadership development.
There are plenty of opportunities that fit your schedule.  If you’re interested in finding out more information about the Chamber, please contact one of our knowledgeable staff at (954) 432-9808 or
[email protected]
.
Mission
Today and into the future, the Chamber is energized about the opportunity to bring innovation and progress to the community by being a Catalyst for business growth, a Convener of leaders to implement positive Change, and a Champion for strong communities.
Vision
By making "Your Business Our Business", the
Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce will remain engaged in the priorities of its membership, businesses, community, and future generations of professionals and their business needs.
History
Our History
The first meeting of the Miramar Pembroke Pines Regional Chamber of Commerce was held in 1969 at the Miramar Diner, with 17 members attending. Ed Minaya, then publisher of The Mirror, brought together 19 local business people and formed a charter to organize the Miramar Pembroke Pines Chamber of Commerce. Incorporation came on December 11, 1969.
Regional
As the Chamber membership has grown, a portion of our membership is derived from outside of the Miramar Pembroke Pines area which keeps us on the cutting edge of the regional concept. Thus, the Chamber added "Regional" to its name.
​Expansion
The Chamber is committed to the growth and success of our area businesses. To that end, the Chamber has expanded its organization and subsidiaries to include a 501(c)3 Scholarship Foundation, a chamber in Pembroke Park & West Park, and a chamber in Weston.

Board of Directors Application Process
Serving on the Chamber's Board of Directors is an important responsibility and brings with it several requirements and expectations to best serve the Chamber membership and business community at large. Board positions are a 3-year commitment. Elections to vacant Board seats are open at the beginning of each year and close on March 1st. Elections take place at our general Membership Breakfast meeting in May.
If you are interested in serving on the Board of Directors, we encourage you to attend the annual Interest Meeting in February. Please check the Event Calendar for meeting details and registration.
Board Responsibilities:
Maintaining an active membership in our Chamber.
Supporting the
bylaws
and policies of the Chamber.
Supporting decisions made by the Board of Directors.
Maintaining confidentiality of Board proceedings including any decisions, who made what motions, and any votes.
Referring any media inquiries to the President or Board Chairperson for comment.
Together with the Board of Directors, establishing policy and determining programs for the Chamber as needed.
Attending all monthly Board meetings (currently held the 4th Thursday of the month at 8:30 AM).
Attending the annual membership meeting.
Attending the annual planning sessions and orientation session of the Board.
Employing a chief executive officer of the Chamber (President) who will administer all Chamber operations and staff.
Attending as many Chamber functions as your personal and business schedule will permit.
At functions, circulating and introducing yourself to members.
Assisting in recruitment and retention of members whenever appropriate.
Serving on a minimum of one committee annually.
Monitoring the annual budget and helping to assure financial stability.
Committing to fundraising a certain amount over the term served, and supporting the financial goals of the organization.
Nomination and Selection Process
Nominations can be made in two ways:
A member may submit a nomination on their own behalf
A member may submit a nomination on behalf of another member
All nominations will go to the Governance/Nomination Committee, which will conduct interviews, and select the most qualified candidates to be on the ballot. The Nominating Committee convenes on the 2nd Friday in March to interview all nominated candidates.
Alternatively, a member may skip the Nomination Committee by collecting signatures from 5% of the membership and submitting them on a petition to be automatically placed on the ballot.
Click here for the petition form
.
If you have any questions about the Board of Directors nomination or selection process, please contact Patty Archer at
patty
@miramarpembrokepines.org
or at (954) 432-9808 ext.104.
Nominate Yourself
Nominate a Member
